original_title: South Australia can launch pilot projects with China, symposium told
article_summary: South Australia and China are set to launch pilot projects in areas such as hydrogen energy, power storage, green agriculture, and prefab buildings, aiming to boost regional cooperation and global sustainable development. This move follows a robust relationship between the two regions, with South Australia's wine, lobsters, and barley being highly sought after in China. The deputy consul-general of China in South Australia emphasized the mutual benefits of international trade and warned against protectionist measures like tariffs, which could cause long-term damage to the global economy.</s>
